intro: Prepusa hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's prepusa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
